alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 12:24AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Anderson County through 100 AM CDT... At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Mound City to 3 miles west of Colony. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Garnett, Colony, Westphalia, Kincaid, Lone Elm and Harris. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for east central Kansas.
